intro: Eleutheranthera ovata, commonly known as the oval leaf eleutheranthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related plants. The plant is characterized by its ovate, glossy leaves and clusters of small, violet-colored flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
